p: Rosemary contains an essential oil to which it owes its interesting properties. It is known for its antioxidant, antimicrobial, anti-inflammatory, anticarcinogenic, antidiabetic [ 4], antinociceptive [ 5], and antithrombotic properties [ 6] and antiulcerogens [ 7], diuretics [ 8], and hepatoprotective effects [ 9]. These biological properties have made rosemary a potential new therapeutic agent in the treatment of many diseases. One of the main derivatives of this emblematic plant in traditional medicine is its essential oil.
